member.summary: Performance-based incentives. Usual value: 0.02 $/kWh for a period of 2 years. This incentive is applied monthly starting with the second month.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Finance.LoanRequest.SREC
member.summary: Solar Renewable Energy Credit. Usual value: 0.05 $/kWh for a period of 2 years. This incentive is applied yearly starting with the first month of the second year.

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.ChargeType.TAX

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.profileId
member.summary: The ID of the usage profile that you want to use for this scenario. Can be set for before, solar, and after. If nothing is set for before or after, the default behavior is to use the account's default profile. You can add more than one profile per scenario and combine them using the operator property on this input. The operator can be + or -, which indicates whether you want to add or subtract the indicated profile's values from the other ones for that scenario. SCENARIOS: before, after, solar

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.providerProfileId
member.summary: The alternative ID for the profile that you want to add to the analysis. SCENARIOS: before, after, solar

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.baselineType
member.summary: If you want to use a typical baseline for the usage in a particular scenario, set a data value of TYPICAL for this property. For solar, use SOLAR_PV. You can use this if you don't have usage or solar data for the account and you just want to do a quick analysis. SCENARIOS: before, after, solar

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.masterTariffId
member.summary: The tariff that will be used for this scenario. If this is not set, it defaults to whatever is currently set as the masterTariffId on the account. SCENARIOS: before, after

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.rateInflation
member.summary: The rate at which the cost of energy raises for every year of the analysis. Use a dataValue of 3.5 to use 3.5%, for example. SCENARIOS: before, after, solar

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.solarDegradation
member.summary: The rate at which energy production from the solar system degrades. If your degradation rate is 0.5% per year, use a value of 0.5 here. SCENARIOS: solar, after

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.projectDuration
member.summary: You can make the project last however long you want. The default is 20 years. SCENARIOS: before, after, solar

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.solarPvLoadOffset
member.summary: If you don't have an existing solar profile, you can use solarPvLoadOffset to specify a percentage of the customer's existing load to offset with a PV system. The system will be a south facing and tilted at 30 degrees. By default (if you just set baselineType to SOLAR_PV for the solar scenario), this will be set to 80%. SCENARIOS: solar, after

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.loadOffset
member.summary: Alternative name for solarPvLoadOffset. SCENARIOS: solar, after

member.name: F:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Enums.SavingAnalysisPropertyInputs.loadSize
member.summary: If you don't have an existing usage profile, use this option in conjunction with a baselineType of TYPICAL to size your customer's annual usage. It will use a typical profile from our database and scale it up or down to the annual value that you specify. SCENARIOS: before, after

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PVWatts5UsageProfileProperties.climateDataSearchRadius
member.summary: The search radius to use when searching for the closest climate data station (miles). Pass in radius=0 to use the closest station regardless of the distance.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PVWatts5UsageProfileProperties.gcr

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress
member.summary: Holds any address and geo-location data an account has.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.addressString
member.summary: Full free text string representing address. This is the property that is usually passed in. Zip will suffice but the full address is better.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.addressName
member.summary: A name associated with the address (e.g. Headquarters). Not usually set.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.address1
member.summary: First part of the address. Usually populated by our address validation from the addressString passed in.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.address2
member.summary: Second part of the address. Usually populated by our address validation from the addressString passed in.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.city
member.summary: City of the address. Usually populated by Genability address validation from the addressString passed in.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.state
member.summary: State of the address. Usually populated by Genability address validation from the addressString passed in.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.zip
member.summary: Postcode or ZIP code of the address. Usually populated by Genability address validation from the addressString passed in.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.country
member.summary: Usually the ISO Country Code of the address. Usually populated by Genability address validation from the addressString passed in.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.lon
member.summary: Longitude of the address. Genability populates this by geo-tagging the address.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAddress.lat
member.summary: Latitude of the address. Genability populates this by geo-tagging the address.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAnalysis
member.summary: The Account Savings Analysis call returns an AccountAnalysis object when you run a calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAnalysis.designId
member.summary: This is null for Account Analysis (so ignore it). It is used in Project Analysis (different endpoint).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAnalysis.dataStatus
member.summary: Represents the status of the underlying data (profiles) that the analysis ran on. 2 means all the underlying data is up to date. 1 means its still processing, and you should run the analysis again once the profile is done (this is very unusual).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAnalysis.summary
member.summary: Account analysis summary.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAnalysis.scenarios
member.summary: Each scenario in the analysis. For a solar PV analysis there will be a "before" for without solar electric bill, "after" for the with solar electric bill, "solar" for the solar system, and "savings" for net savings with solar (before - after + solar).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAnalysis.series
member.summary: A list of Series objects, each one describing the data points (SeriesMeasure) it contains. The Series object is documented in further detail below.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAnalysis.seriesData
member.summary: This list holds the actual data points, each of type SeriesMeasure (described below). Each ties to a particular series (above) using a unique integer value. Each SeriesMeasure holds a rate, quantity, and cost.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAnalysis.seriesCosts
member.summary: If populateCosts is set to true, this field is populated with CalculatedCost objects corresponding to each series. They are indexed by seriesId, which you can find from the series collection.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountAnalysisSummary
member.summary: The summary for an account analysis.

member.summary: The class that holds an account properties.

member.summary: The account customer class property.

member.summary: Each account property has a keyName (these correspond 1 to 1 with property values), and a dataValue.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountProperty.keyName
member.summary: The unique name of this key, e.g. customerClass.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.AccountProperty.dataValue
member.summary: The value of this account property.

member.summary: The data type of the value.

member.summary: The optional end date and time of this property, if applicable.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.BaselineMeasure
member.summary: These are simply an index (i) which increases in chronological order from 1 to 8760 (if hourly) or 4 x 8760 (if 15 minutes), and a value (v) that denotes that intervals value.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.BaselineMeasure.i
member.summary: Interval of the year (hour or month).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.BaselineMeasure.v
member.summary: Amount (value) for this interval.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost
member.summary: The CalculatedCost object contains the summary of the calculation. The totalCost field holds the overall cost while the details of the calculation are contained within a list of calculated cost items. CalculatedCost also contains the list of inputs that were used in this calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost.masterTariffId
member.summary: Unique Genability ID for the master tariff of this tariff.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost.tariffName
member.summary: The name of this tariff.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost.fromDateTime
member.summary: The start date and time of this calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost.toDateTime
member.summary: The end date and time of this calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost.totalCost
member.summary: Total summed up cost of all cost items (see below).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost.summary
member.summary: A summary map of totalCost, kWh, and kW used in the calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost.accuracy
member.summary: A decimal value between 0 and 1 representing the accuracy of the calculation. As more best guess calculation assumptions are made, the calculation will become less accurate and the accuracy field will be smaller.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost.assumptions
member.summary: The assumptions that were used by the calculator. In the event that a required input was not provided, the calculator will make a best guess assumption for what was used. The accuracy field of each PropertyData item indicates how accurate this input was, with values ranging from 0 - 1 with 1 being a completely accurate input.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCost.items
member.summary: Array of the CalculatedCostItem objects that comprise this calculated cost. These will be summarized as requested. Currently this is one item per tariff rate, but soon there will be other options for levels of summary or detail.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem
member.summary: The calculated cost items contain the details of the calculations. There is one CalculatedCostItem object for each tariff rate that is included in the calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.tariffRateId
member.summary: Unique Genability ID of the tariff rate that this charge.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.tariffRateBandId
member.summary: Unique Genability ID for the band that this charge reached.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.rateGroupName
member.summary: The name of the group this rate belongs to.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.rateName
member.summary: The name of this rate.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.rateAmount
member.summary: The value of this rate.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.fromDateTime
member.summary: The start date and time of the period applicable for this cost item.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.toDateTime
member.summary: The end date and time of the period applicable for this cost item.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.rateType
member.summary: The type of rate this charge is. Current values include "COST_PER_UNIT" which is a cost for each unit of quantity consumed (e.g. $0.10 per kWh), and "PERCENTAGE" which is a percent of another cost (e.g. 10% of your bill).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.quantityKey
member.summary: The key for the quantity this calculated cost item refers to. Possible values include: fixed, consumption, minimum.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.itemQuantity
member.summary: Total quantity used for this item's charge. This will typically be 1 but will have different values for charges related to the number of units of some items (e.g. number of billing meters at a facility).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.itemCount
member.summary: This is reserved for future use, to denote the count of items rolled up when getting the results summarized. This will typically be 1.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.cost
member.summary: This is the total cost for this line item.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostItem.accuracy
member.summary: The accuracy of this item, between 0 and 1. Currently not populated.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CalculatedCostSummaryMap
member.summary: A summary map of totalCost, kWh, and kW used in the calculation.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest
member.summary: The request class for running a new cost calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.fromDateTime
member.summary: Starting date and time for this Calculate request. (Required)

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.toDateTime
member.summary: End date and time for this Calculate request. (Required)

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.providerAccountId
member.summary: The providerAccountId of the account for which to run this calculation. This will cause the calculator to take default values from the specified account, but you can override values contained in the account by passing in values through the inputs array below. (Optional)

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.profileId
member.summary: Use an explicit Profile for this calculation. (Optional)

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.minimums
member.summary: This field enables enforcing minimum charges on this calculation. (Optional, Default=false)

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.detailLevel
member.summary: Toggles the level of details for the calculation result. (Optional) Possible values are: ALL - return all details for this calculation (default) TOTAL - return only the overall total, without any details CHARGE_TYPE - group the details by charge types, such as FIXED, CONSUMPTION, QUANTITY RATE - group the details by rates. This is most similar to how a utility bill is constructed.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.groupBy
member.summary: This controls how the calculation details are grouped, for example grouping the details by month or year. There is no default value; if not specified the details will use the frequency contained within the rates. (Optional) MONTH - groups the calculation details by month. YEAR - groups the calculation details by year.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.billingPeriod
member.summary: A true or false flag. If the dates of the calculation represent an actual billing cycle, then you should set this to true. This will give you precise values for items like fixed charges. When it's not set, or set to false, these charges will be prorated across the number of days in the calculation. Default is false. (Optional)

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.tariffInputs
member.summary: The input values to use when running the calculation. This is where you would specify an accountId as well as any other inputs. Note: accountId can also be specified as a query string parameter, e.g. accountId=abc123. If you are not specifying any inputs, you must still include an empty tariffInputs field. (Required)

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CostCalculatorRequest.rateInputs
member.summary: The rate input values are used to override existing rates on the tariff during the calculation. This enables modeling and/or setting customer specific rates during a calculation. (Optional)

member.summary: The response class for running a new cost calculation.

member.summary: The response status.

member.summary: The results count.

member.summary: The response type.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CreateAccountRequest.providerAccountId
member.summary: If you use a unique identifier for this account in your own systems, you can specify that here. This allows you to quickly tie your own data with what you create with the Genability APIs. This must be unique within your accounts.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CreateAccountRequest.accountName
member.summary: This is the name of the account. We suggest using this field to identify the entity this account represents. For a small business, this could the name of the business. For a larger business with multiple locations, this could be the name of the location, e.g. Starbucks, Briarwood Mall.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CreateAccountRequest.address
member.summary: Holds any address and geo-location data this account has.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CreateAccountRequest.properties
member.summary: The Account has a field named properties which is a collection of zero or more properties. Each entry has a keyName (these correspond 1 to 1 with property values), and a dataValue.

member.summary: The response class for creating a new account.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CreateAccountResponse.status
member.summary: The response status.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CreateAccountResponse.count
member.summary: The results count.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CreateAccountResponse.type
member.summary: The response type.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.CreateAccountResponse.results

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount
member.summary: An Account object is a place where you can store your customers' energy, cost, and savings data. Accounts typically represent your actual customers and potential customers, and are most useful when you map an account to a facility, such as a home or business. Genability recommends mapping an account to a site, and even if the site has multiple meters, although sometimes it's helpful to consider having an account for each individual utility meter location. Accounts are completely private and only visible to your organization.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.accountId
member.summary: This is the unique Genability ID of this Account object.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.providerAccountId
member.summary: If you use a unique identifier for this account in your own systems, you can specify that here. This allows you to quickly tie your own data with what you create with the Genability APIs. This must be unique within your accounts.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.accountName
member.summary: This is the name of the account. We suggest using this field to identify the entity this account represents. For a small business, this could the name of the business. For a larger business with multiple locations, this could be the name of the location, e.g. Starbucks, Briarwood Mall.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.customerOrgId
member.summary: This allows grouping of accounts together. The customerOrgId should be an ID you use in your own systems to identify this account. Specifying a customerOrgId simplifies tying the account to your own data.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.customerOrgName
member.summary: This is the name of the account's organization. We suggest using this field to identify the name of the account's business. For example, Starbucks.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.address
member.summary: Holds any address and geo-location data this account has.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.timeZone
member.summary: The timezone that this account is located in. They are in the tz database format.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.owner
member.summary: Use this to set the person who currently "owns" this account (otherwise its null).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.status
member.summary: This indicates the status of this account. Possible values are: ACTIVE (defaults to this), INACTIVE and DELETED.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.type
member.summary: This indicates the status of this account. Possible values are: ACTIVE (defaults to this), INACTIVE and DELETED.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.properties
member.summary: This is a list of properties that exist on this account.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.GenabilityAccount.tariffs
member.summary: This is a list of tariffs that are on the account.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity
member.summary: Load Serving Entity (LSE) is the industry term for what most people would call a utility, or an electric company.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.lseId
member.summary: Unique Genability ID (primary key) for each LSE.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.name
member.summary: Published name of the company.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.code
member.summary: Short code (an alternate key). For US companies this is the EIA ID.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.websiteHome
member.summary: The URL to the home page of the LSE website.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.offeringType
member.summary: Whether the offerings are bundled or one of energy or delivery.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.ownership
member.summary: Ownership structure. Most common values are "INVESTOR", "COOP", "MUNI". Other include "FEDERAL", "POLITICAL_SUBDIVISION", "RETAIL_ENERGY_MARKETER", "WHOLESALE_ENERGY_MARKETER", "TRANSMISSION", "STATE", "UNREGULATED".

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.serviceTypes
member.summary: Service types offered to any customer. Current values include "ELECTRICITY" and "SOLAR_PV".

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.totalRevenues

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.totalSales

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.LoadServingEntity.totalCustomers
member.summary: Total customer count.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price
member.summary: The Price object then contains an array of PriceChange objects. By default there is one for each actual change in price during the requested date range, or you can ask for prices grouped by "HOUR", "DAY", "MONTH" and "YEAR".

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price.description
member.summary: Description of the actual or Smart Tariff.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price.masterTariffId
member.summary: Unique Genability ID (primary key) for this tariff.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price.fromDateTime
member.summary: The starting date and time for this price summary.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price.toDateTime
member.summary: The ending date and time for this price summary.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price.detailLevel
member.summary: The level of granularity that the price is returned in.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price.currency
member.summary: The ISO currency code for which the prices are returned (e.g. USD).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price.rateMean
member.summary: The mean value of the rate within the specified time period.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price.rateStandardDeviation
member.summary: The standard deviation of all the prices within the specified time period.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Price.priceChanges
member.summary: An array containing details of all of the price changes within the specified time period.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PriceChange
member.summary: Price change within the specified time period.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PriceChange.name
member.summary: Name of this change. Usually something like the time of use period. For display purposes.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PriceChange.fromDateTime
member.summary: Date and Time when this change begins. In ISO 8601 format.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PriceChange.toDateTime
member.summary: Date and Time when this change ends. In ISO 8601 format.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PriceChange.rateAmount
member.summary: The actual charge amount for this price change.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PriceChange.rateAmountDelta
member.summary: The mean delta of this price change compared to the overall mean across all price changes. Good for understanding if this is a high or low price relative to the rest of the period.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PropertyData
member.summary: Property data and tariff inputs are closely related. Property data tells you the properties associated with the calculation of this tariff. Tariff inputs are the populated properties you pass in when running a calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PropertyData.keyName
member.summary: The key name of the property associated with this input. The most common one will be consumption (which is the kWh for the period), and second most common is demand (kW), but can also be applicability properties like cityLimits or hasElectricVehicle.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PropertyData.dataValue
member.summary: The value of this Property.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PropertyData.dataType
member.summary: The type of this property. Possible values are: "STRING", "CHOICE", "BOOLEAN", "DATE", "DECIMAL", "INTEGER", and "FORMULA".

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PropertyData.fromDateTime
member.summary: The start date and time of this calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PropertyData.toDateTime
member.summary: The end date and time of this calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.PropertyData.unit
member.summary: Where applicable, this is the unit of the value. Most common are: "kWh" - for keys of consumption, "kW" - for keys of demand.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData
member.summary: ReadingData objects contain the point in time readings of a usage profile. There are typically hundreds or thousands of reading data elements per usage profile.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData.keyName
member.summary: The type of data this reading represents. Typically will be 'consumption'.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData.fromDateTime
member.summary: Date and time this reading starts.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData.toDateTime
member.summary: Date and time this reading ends.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData.duration
member.summary: Length of this interval.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData.timeAccuracy
member.summary: Value representing the accuracy, in ms, of the time reading.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData.quantityUnit
member.summary: Unit of this reading. Typically will be 'kWh'.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData.quantityValue
member.summary: Value of this reading. e.g. the number of kWh.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData.quantityAccuracy
member.summary: Indicator of the accuracy of the reading, in the same units as the quantityValue.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingData.touType
member.summary: One of OFF_PEAK, PARTIAL_PEAK, ON_PEAK, or CRITICAL_PEAK. Used for uploading TOU-based energy consumption data.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.ReadingDataSummary
member.summary: The profile has one ReadingDataSummary object for each series of data (a series is a unique quantityUnit). These are read-only. The system creates and updates them as you add and update reading data to your profile. They provide a high level summary of the readings contained in each data series in this Profile, including the number of readings and the start and end dates of the reading range.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingAnalysisTariffRate
member.summary: Class that extends TariffRate.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingAnalysisTariffRate.scenario
member.summary: "scenarios":"before,after". Think of a scenario as one service that your customer pays for (like electricity that they pay the utility for or solar that they pay a lease or PPA on). A scenario therefor needs a tariff (rate plan) too. You need at least two scenarios otherwise there wouldn't be anything to compare to get savings.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisRequest
member.summary: The savings analysis endpoint is very flexible. From this single endpoint, you can configure your analysis in thousands of different ways. You can change your account's tariff to a different one in the "after" scenario, you can change how quickly electricity rates go up each year, or you can use an entirely different solar power system than the one that you proposed. To enable all of that flexibility, you have a lot of different parameters to chose from. They are split into three groups: top level parameters that set the stage for the entire analysis, property inputs that define the parameters of each scenario, and rate inputs that let you specify entirely new rates to apply to your analysis.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisRequest.accountId
member.summary: The Genability-generated ID of the account for which you want to do the savings analysis.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisRequest.providerAccountId
member.summary: The alternative ID of the account for which you want to do the savings analysis.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisRequest.fromDateTime
member.summary: The start of your analysis. This setting affects the version of the account's tariffs that are in effect during the first year of the analysis. You can use DateTime.now() or simliar to force the use of the most recent version of your account's tariffs.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisRequest.toDateTime
member.summary: Sets the duration of the intial period of the analysis. The default is one year.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisRequest.propertyInputs
member.summary: The parameters for the analysis. There are many different options available.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisRequest.rateInputs
member.summary: Custom tariffs for this analysis. You can use this to define lease rates, PPA rates, or special tax rates. Make sure to set the scenario property so that your rate is applied correctly.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisRequest.populateCosts
member.summary: If set to true, your results will contain an even more detailed breakdown of the first year of results for this calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisRequest.useIntelligentBaselining
member.summary: Previously, running a Savings Analysis required a full year of usage coverage. With Intelligent Baselining on, you can use as little as one monthly bill to estimate usage. (Using two or more months of billing data if available will increase accuracy.)

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisResponse
member.summary: The data that you get back from the savings analysis represents a complete description of the results of your calculation.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisResponse.status
member.summary: The response status.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisResponse.count
member.summary: The results count.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisResponse.type
member.summary: The response type.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SavingsAnalysisResponse.results
member.summary: The returned account analysis.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Scenario
member.summary: A Savings Analysis has at least two Scenario objects in its response. For a solar PV analysis there are 4. You only need to worry about sending this in a request to the Savings Calculator when running a generic analysis type.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Scenario.id
member.summary: This is not used for Account Analysis (it's used for Project Analysis) Will be null. Ignore it.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Scenario.name
member.summary: The unique name (key) of this scenario. Solar PV has "before", "after", "solar" and "savings".

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Scenario.serviceType
member.summary: The type of service for this scenario. "ELECTRICITY" or "SOLAR_PV".

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Scenario.inputs
member.summary: The important inputs that were used in this scenarios calculation. This defines the usage data profiles, the rate plan and plan arguments and other parameters for the calc.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Scenario.rates
member.summary: Used to pass the sites specific contracted electricity rates (only needed if they are in a deregulated market), their tax rates (if you want us to calculate post tax numbers), and possibly their solar offers PPA or lease rate.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series
member.summary: The Series object denotes the scenario, time frame, granularity of each data series in the results.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.seriesId
member.summary: All the series measures (below) for this series have this identifier. It is a unique integer within the response. You should not assume the integer will be the same for the same series between responses. Instead look at the series' period, duration, and scenario fields to find the seriesId you need.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.fromDateTime
member.summary: The start date of the series.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.toDateTime
member.summary: The end date of the series.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.scenario
member.summary: Mathematical formula of scenarios that produced this series.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.displayLabel
member.summary: The display label for this series.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.seriesPeriod
member.summary: The series period/term. Possible values are: "YEAR", "MONTH", "DAY", and "HOUR".

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.seriesDuration
member.summary: The duration of the series with respect to the seriesPeriod. e.g. if this is 20 and seriesPeriod is "YEAR", this series' data covers 20 years.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.designId
member.summary: Not populated for Account Analysis.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.key
member.summary: For future use.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.rate
member.summary: Average rate over the entire duration of this series.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.qty
member.summary: Total quantity over the entire duration of this series.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Series.cost
member.summary: Total cost over the entire duration of this series.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SeriesCosts
member.summary: Class containing CalculatedCost objects corresponding to each series. They are indexed by seriesId, which you can find from the series collection.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SeriesMeasure
member.summary: The SeriesMeasure object holds one data point, such as before solar electricity in the first year.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SeriesMeasure.seriesId
member.summary: The identifier of the series that that this data point belongs to.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SeriesMeasure.fromDateTime
member.summary: Start date and time of this data point.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SeriesMeasure.toDateTime
member.summary: End date and time of this data point.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SeriesMeasure.rate
member.summary: The average rate of charge for this timeframe, denominated in the major currency applicable. For instance, in USD this would be 0.12 for 12 cents.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SeriesMeasure.qty
member.summary: Quantity for this timeframe (usage or production etc typically in kWh).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.SeriesMeasure.cost
member.summary: Cost (or savings) of this timeframe.

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff
member.summary: Tariffs are rate plans for electricity. They describe who the plan applies to (service and applicability), what the charges are, and other information about this electricity service.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.tariffId
member.summary: Unique Genability ID (primary key) for this tariff.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.masterTariffId
member.summary: Unique Genability ID that persists across all revisions of this tariff.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.tariffCode
member.summary: Short code that the LSE uses as an alternate name for the tariff.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.tariffName
member.summary: Name of the tariff as used by the LSE.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.lseId
member.summary: ID of load serving entity this tariff belongs to.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.lseName
member.summary: Name of the load serving entity.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.serviceType
member.summary: Type of service for the tariff. Current values include ELECTRICITY (grid power) and SOLAR_PV (Solar PPA or Lease).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.priorTariffId
member.summary: Unique Genability ID that identifies the prior revision of the tariffId above.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.distributionLseId
member.summary: In states like Texas where the load serving entity that sells the power is different than the load serving entity that distributes the power, this will contain the ID of the distribution LSE. Otherwise, it will be null.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.tariffType

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.Tariff.customerClass

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.TariffRate.chargeType
member.summary: Possible values: FIXED_PRICE - a fixed charge for the period CONSUMPTION_BASED - based on quantity used (e.g. kW/h) DEMAND_BASED - based on the peak demand (e.g. kW) QUANTITY - a rate per number of items (e.g. $5 per street light) FORMULA - a rate that has a specific or custom formula MINIMUM - a minimum amount that the LSE will charge you, regardless of the other charges TAX - a percentage tax rate which is applied to the sum of all of the other charges on a bill

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.TariffRate.chargeClass
member.summary: A comma separated string that indicates what class(es) of charges this rate is for. Values include TRANSMISSION, DISTRIBUTION, SUPPLY, TAX, and OTHER. Also, this field indicates whether the rate is CONTRACTED (by-passable).

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.TariffRate.chargePeriod
member.summary: Indicates what period this charge is calculated for. This is usually the same as the billing period (and is usually monthly) but can be other intervals. Possible values are: MONTHLY - each calendar month DAILY - calculated for each day QUARTERLY - every 3 months ANNUALLY - every year

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.TariffRate.transactionType
member.summary: Indicates whether this rate is BUY (no credit when supplying back), SELL (e.g. a feed in tariff), or NET (you get a credit, e.g. net metering).

member.name: T:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.UsageProfile
member.summary: A usage profile organizes together one or more series' of usage data. This data can include electricity consumption (kWh) or demand (kW). It can take the form of bills or meter readings, and can be for electricity purchased from the utility or on-site solar energy. They can also take into account usage reduction through energy efficiency. Profiles belong to an Account object, and it is typical, although not required, to have at least one profile per account.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.UsageProfile.profileId
member.summary: Unique Genability ID (UUID) for this usage profile.

member.summary: Optional alternate key.

member.summary: (Optional) Your specified name for this usage profile.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.UsageProfile.accountId
member.summary: Required accountId for this usage profile. This is useful for linking usage profiles to your own customer Ids.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.UsageProfile.providerAccountId
member.summary: Provider account id.

member.summary: Optional description for this Usage Profile.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.UsageProfile.serviceTypes
member.summary: Comma separated strings of the types of service this profile denotes. Current types include "ELECTRICITY" and "SOLAR_PV".

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.UsageProfile.source
member.summary: Optional. Source contains a sourceId and name (both strings). Uniquely identify the source of this profile. e.g. "PVWatts"

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.UsageProfile.sourceId
member.summary: You won't usually construct a full Source object when uploading a usage profile. Instead, you can just set the sourceId property. There are three options that you should choose from: ReadingEntry: When uploading any kind of usage data through the profile endpoint, you should use ReadingEntry. PVWatts: If you want to have the integrated PVWatts engine create a solar profile for you, use a sourceId of PVWatts. This will default to PVWatts v4. If you want to use v5, you'll need to create a full Source object. SolarPvModel: If you have any any other kind of solar simulation data that you want to upload through the profile endpoint, use SolarPvModel. If you have PVSyst or Helioscope CSVs, you can also use the File Uploader.

member.name: P:DataReef.TM.Models.DTOs.Solar.Genability.UsageProfile.isDefault
member.summary: Denotes whether this is the default profile for the service type. Default profiles are used for calcs when no profile is specified.

member.summary: Our standard collection of PropertyData denoting properties specific to this Profile.

member.summary: Read-only value that Genability maintains to show how up-to-date the profile number crunching is. 1=processing, 2= done, 3=error (we auto-fix 3)
